channel.title: [TUT]A way to script on Macintosh ( not run ).[TUT]
channel.description:
Okay, I know alot of you have macintosh, so I will post away so you can create scripts. You cannot use them, but you can sell them once you have followed the steps given below.
1. Write the script on here, using the code option, for example:
[scar]Program New; const = User('UserName'); // RS Username goes here. Pass('PassWord'); // RS Password goes here.
Begin;
*your code*
End.[/scar]
2. Copy and paste it OR post it and get a Windows user to convert to .Scar for you.
This way, when you are smart enough to actually buy a Windows computer/laptop, you will still be able to know how to script.

item.title: [TUT]A way to script on Macintosh ( not run ).[TUT]
item.dc:creator: @N4TH4N N4TH4N
item.description:
@N4TH4N wrote:

Simpler to just code it in notepad and save as .scar, though no real point because you can’t test your code without having SCAR to compile it for you. The formatting(colors and bold) in SCAR is just for looks.

Read full topic
item.source: [TUT]A way to script on Macintosh ( not run ).[TUT]

item.title: [TUT]A way to script on Macintosh ( not run ).[TUT]
item.dc:creator: @Run_From_Aut Run From Aut
item.description:
@Run_From_Aut wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:4, topic:29281”]What he means is just write the script in say a text editor and save it in a .scar format and get windows to use it.[/quote]The above states just how easy it is to understand it. When I posted this post, yes indeed I was on a Macintosh, but I have more than one laptop. The code given above was not actual code, but was an Eggs-Arm-Pull ( can you say that? ) of what your text would look like.

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT]A way to script on Macintosh ( not run ).[TUT]
item.dc:creator: @Run_From_Aut Run From Aut
item.description:
@Run_From_Aut wrote:

Okay, I know alot of you have macintosh, so I will post away so you can create scripts. You cannot use them, but you can sell them once you have followed the steps given below.

  1. Write the script on here, using the code option, for example:

            [scar]Program New;

const = User(‘UserName’); // RS Username goes here.
Pass(‘PassWord’); // RS Password goes here.

Begin;

your code

End.[/scar]

  1. Copy and paste it OR post it and get a Windows user to convert to .Scar for you.

This way, when you are smart enough to actually buy a Windows computer/laptop, you will still
be able to know how to script.
